meanings.definition: An action or event that precedes or prepares for something else.
meanings.sent1: The rehearsal was just a prelim before the big show.
meanings.sent2: The prelim meeting helped us plan for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The prelim dance-off between the two teams was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The prelim rounds of the competition were like warm-up exercises.
meanings.sent5: Attending the prelim workshop was a helpful start to the training program.

meanings.sent1: She aced the prelim and felt confident for the final exam.
meanings.sent2: The prelim for the science fair required a detailed hypothesis.
meanings.sent3: Taking the prelim was nerve-wracking but necessary.
meanings.sent4: The prelim acted as a checkpoint to assess students' understanding.
meanings.sent5: Scoring well on the prelim boosted his overall grade in the course.

meanings.definition: Something that comes before the main event.
meanings.sent1: The appetizer was just a prelim to the delicious main course.
meanings.sent2: The opening act served as a prelim to the headlining band.
meanings.sent3: The prelim speeches set the tone for the rest of the event.
meanings.sent4: The prelim rounds of the tournament determined the top contenders.
meanings.sent5: The prelim ceremony kicked off the grand celebration.
